p: If all the traditional methods to identify viruses have failed and when the viral pathogen is not culturable in vitro, then NGS is a very powerful tool to discover novel viruses. For example, a novel ssRNA virus was detected from carp ( Cyprinus carpio) in Hungary by metagenomics. Its genome proved to be 8712 nucleotide in lengths. The virus was named fisavirus, phylogenetic calculations clustered it under the order Picornavirales, and it shows a distant relation to posaviruses, however a novel family should probably be established for this virus ( Reuter et al., 2015).
